function.name: bgColor_cmd
function.description: Sets the background color of the Pymol window

color.description: The color, e.g. red, blue, green, white, black, deeppurple

rgb.description: The RGB decimal format, e.g. [1.0, 0.0, 0.0] for red

function.name: cartoon_cmd
function.description: Sets the cartoon style of the on-screen view

selection.description: The name of the selection to set these changes on, defaults to all open molecules if not provided

function.name: bond_cmd
function.description: Creates a new bond between two selections, each of which should contain one atom.

atom1.description: The selection group that contains the first atom e.g. pk1, pk2, sele

atom2.description: The selection group that contains the second atom e.g. pk1, pk2, sele

function.name: create_cmd
function.description: Creates a new molecule object from a selection.  It can also be used to update an existing object to the selection.

name.description: The name of the new molecule to be created, or the name of the object to be updated

selection.description: The name of the selection to create from, or the name of the selection to update to

function.name: origin_cmd
function.description: Sets center of rotation (origin). Defaults to the center of all objects if params null.

selection.description: The name of the selection or object which should be set as the origin / center of rotation. E.g. pk1, sele, molecule1

position.description: An array of numbers that represent the XYZ coordinates that should be set as the origin / center of rotation. E.g. [1.0,2.0,3.0]

function.name: protect_cmd
function.description: Protects a set of atoms from transformations

selection.description: The selection of atoms to protect

function.name: refresh_cmd
function.description: Causes the scene to be redrawn as soon as the operating system allows it to be done.

function.name: attach_cmd
function.description: Attaches the described atom to the position selected on-screen

element.description: The element (Symbol) to be attached e.g. O for Oxygen, H for Hydrogen

geometry.description: The geometry (steric number) of added atom e.g. 1

valence.description: The valence of the added atom e.g. 2

function.name: backward_cmd
function.description: Moves the movie back one frame

button.description: The mouse button to redefine (e.g., left, middle, right, wheel, double_left, etc.)

modifier.description: The modifier key associated with the button (e.g., None, Shft, Ctrl, CtSh, etc.).

action.description: The action to be performed when the button is clicked (e.g., Rota, Move, MovZ, etc.)

function.name: color_cmd
function.description: Changes the color of objects or atoms.

selection.description: Selection expression or name pattern corresponding to the atoms or objects to be colored.

function.name: fetch_cmd
function.description: Downloads a file from the internet (if possible).

code.description: A single PDB identifier or a list of identifiers. Supports 5-letter codes for fetching single chains (e.g., '1a00A').

name.description: The object name into which the file should be loaded.

state.description: The state number into which the file should be loaded.

type.description: The file type to fetch. Options include cif, pdb, pdb1, 2fofc, fofc, emd, cid, sid.

async_.description: Whether to download in the background and not block the PyMOL command line.

path.description: The path to save the downloaded file.

function.name: deselect_cmd
function.description: Disables any and all visible selections.

function.name: id_atom_cmd
function.description: Returns the original source ID of a single atom
